instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
threads.message:
I got this machine after it was at another workshop, they removed the EFI <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and the <CHIP>U5870</CHIP>, I replaced them from a dead board but now i got fan spinning and stuck in the middle of boot line, I understand from someone that the EFI need to be reprogrammed can anyone guide me to it? Louis I know that you are against removing EFI etc. but this one came like that, the costumer delivered the machine with another issue to this butcher but got it back with no power (half spinning fans).
Also, what if I replace the SMC to? will that fix the problem?

threads.title: Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
threads.message: Bios backup. Do you have a bios programmer that can copy the bios file?

threads.title: Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 4325"]Board number please, 820-xxxx[/QUOTE]

Took the parts from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and replaced them on the missing board which is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A which looks 100% identical..guess thats why, can you confirm?

threads.title: Macbook pro 13" retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EFI issue
threads.message: Use your programmer and program on the refi chip.....
